Article Title: Intelligence agencies monitor expansion of terrorist infrastructure in POK
Article Text:
Representative image.

BSF IG Warns Of Looming Threat As 120 Terrorists Wait In PoK Despite Dip In Infiltration Attempts

NEW DELHI: Intelligence agencies are alarmed and closely monitoring the expansion of terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK). Satellite imagery and photographs reveal the construction of a new "dual-use facility" in the Neelum Valley district.Since November, LeT accelerated the infrastructure build-up of the new centre, named "Jamia Masjid Ibn Taymiyah wa Markaz," being erected in the Sharda area. This facility, sources said, was explicitly designed to function simultaneously as both a religious structure and a command-and-control centre for terrorist activities, raising acute concerns about the deepening entrenchment of terrorist operations in the region."The project's operational significance was underscored by the recent visit and inspection of the Neelum Valley site by Rizwan Hanif, the Deputy of LeT's PoK unit," the source added. According to intelligence sources, this facility is one of four major Markaz (centres) currently under construction by LeT across PoK, with others planned for DhirKot, Bagh; Khaigala, Rawalakot; and Palandri, Sudhanoti.These parallel projects signal a coordinated effort by LeT to dramatically expand its logistical and ideological footprint across the territory while shifting a major chunk of its resources to Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.The strategy is to create multiple small infrastructures instead of a massive centralised Markaz. Rawalakot has emerged as another major construction hub for terror infrastructure. Many launchpads here were destroyed by the Indian Army in Operation Sindoor.LeT is now readying terrorist launch pads at these locations under the guise of mosques. "A huge building is being constructed in the Khaigala area of Rawalakot which will act as a launchpad but in reality, this is again a dual-use facility, named Al-Aqsa Markaz. LeT is attempting to portray it as a mosque. LeT's PoK spokesperson, Aamir Zia, recently released a video initially referring to it as a mosque, but accidentally called it a Markaz during the conversation," a source added.
Article Summary: Satellite imagery and photographs reveal the construction of a new "dual-use facility" in the neelum valley district. This facility, sources said, was explicitly designed to function simultaneously as both a religious structure and a command-and-control centre for terrorist activities.

Article Title: Sule pushes for work-life balance, brings bill on employees‚Äô right to disconnect
Article Text:
.

New Delhi: Bringing into focus the importance of work-life balance in the digital era, NCP (SP)‚Äôs Supriya Sule has introduced a private member‚Äôs bill in Lok Sabha proposing establishing an ‚Äòemployees welfare authority‚Äô to confer the right on employees to disconnect from work-related phone calls & e-mails beyond work hours and on holidays.‚ÄúRight to Disconnect Bill, 2025, fosters a better quality of life and a healthier work-life balance by reducing burnout caused by today‚Äôs digital culture,‚Äù Sule had said on X after the bill was introduced on Dec 5. Friday is reserved for private member‚Äôs bills in Parliament.The ‚Äòstatement of objects and reasons‚Äô of the bill says: ‚ÄúAccording to a report released by World Economic Forum, the proportion of mobile workers who could work from any location, is expected to rise beyond 70%. While this has benefits in terms of work flexibility, it also carries with it a significant risk of erosion of boundaries between professional and personal life.‚ÄùThe bill emphasises ‚Äúthe need to respect personal space of employees by recognising their right to disconnect and not respond to their employers‚Äô calls, emails, etc, during out-of-work hours‚Äù. It seeks to impose sanctions at the rate of 1% of total employees‚Äô remuneration on entities (companies or societies) for any non-compliance with the bill‚Äôs provisions.The bill also provides for counselling services to increase awareness among employees and citizens, on reasonable use of digital and communication tools, for professional and personal use. To free employees from digital distractions and enable them to truly connect with people around then, it provides for digital detox centres.The bill also takes into consideration the competitive needs of companies and their diverse work cultures. Calling for flexibility in the right to disconnect rules, it leaves it to the companies to negotiate terms of service with their employees for working out-of-work hours.‚ÄúThe bill thus champions for the rights and welfare of employees, by mandating individual entities to negotiate out-of-hour service conditions with their employees, and upholding the right of employee to disconnect,‚Äù it stated.
Article Summary: Ncp‚Äôs supriya sule has introduced a bill in lok sabha to confer the right on employees to disconnect from work-related phone calls & e-mails beyond work hours and on holidays. The bill also provides for counselling services to increase awareness among employees and citizens, on reasonable use of digital and communication tools.

Article Title: Rey Mysterio and Angie Gutierrez combined net worth in 2025: Earnings, assets, and career income
Article Text:
Rey Mysterio and Angie Gutierrez (Image Source: Getty)

Rey Mysterio and Angie Gutierrez's overall wealth in 2025

Rey Mysterio's career highlights, cars and other assets

Rey Mysterio is still one of the most popular figures in pro wrestling, and his long-term marriage to Angie Gutierrez adds a warm personal touch to his overall success story. The power couple have built a pretty good life for themselves through a lot of hard work and making smart choices along the way.People can't help but wonder where their financial situation is at these days, specifically, how much they're worth in the year 2025. Reports have been coming in saying the pair is sitting on around $11 million as of today's date, with most of that money coming from Rey's wrestling career and the business ventures that come along with it.Rey Mysterio has earned most of the couple's fortune over decades in wrestling. Current estimates place his personal net worth at about $10 million as of 2025. This amount reflects years of contracts with major promotions like WWE and WCW. Additionally, merchandise sales play a big role in his income.Fans love buying his iconic masks and apparel worldwide. On the other hand, Angie Gutierrez brings in around $1 million from her activities. She has worked in acting and entrepreneurship over the years. Together, their combined net worth stands strong at approximately $11 million.This wealth allows them a luxurious yet grounded lifestyle in California.Moreover, Rey's annual earnings include a base salary of roughly $174,000 from WWE. Bonuses from events and endorsements add more to that total. The couple invests wisely in properties and enjoys family time. Their financial journey highlights teamwork and perseverance.Rey Mysterio started wrestling young and quickly became a high-flying star. He joined WWE years ago and won multiple championships along the way. His style revolutionized cruiserweight divisions in the industry. Furthermore, he earned substantial income from peak contracts and pay-per-view appearances. Assets include a beautiful home in Chula Vista worth over $1 million. This property features modern amenities for the whole family.Additionally, Rey owns several luxury cars, like a Rolls-Royce and a Lamborghini. These vehicles show his taste for quality and speed. Merchandise remains a steady income source even now.Angie works tirelessly to keep the household running smoothly while also supporting her husband in all that he does. The assets they've accumulated over the years are a testament to the smart planning they've done throughout their careers. All of these holdings are really going to set them up for a long and secure future.Also Read: Cody Rhodes and Brandi Rhodes relationship timeline: Career crossroads, milestones, and family
Article Summary: Rey mysterio and angie gutierrez have a combined net worth of around $11 million. Most of the money comes from rey's wrestling career and the business ventures that come along with it. The couple also owns several luxury cars, like a rolls-royce and a lamborghini.

Article Title: 'Relocate to USA and India': Indian-origin businessman forced to move as firm gives up nuclear licence, 200 'high-tech jobs' at risk
Article Text:
'Trump Needs Indian Skilled Workers': Expert On Big Tech's AI Bet On India





An Indian-origin businessman who owns a long-established medical manufacturer in Kanata (High-tech suburb of Ottawa) says he is being forced to relocate operations to India and US as the company gives up its nuclear licence. This is a move he says will cost hundreds of high-tech jobs.Krishnan Suthanthiran, owner of Best Theratronics, said surrendering the licence would lead to ‚Äúthe loss of 200 high-tech jobs‚Äù after Canada‚Äôs nuclear regulator took action over the company‚Äôs failure to meet licence conditions.On Friday, the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission (CNSC) confirmed that Best Theratronics is in the process of removing the nuclear materials it used to manufacture cancer treatment devices. The company has secured export licences to ship its Cobalt 60 and Cesium 137 sealed sources out of Canada, officials said during a public meeting.Best Theratronics was once a Crown agency and helped develop the world‚Äôs first cancer treatment machine, reports CBC News. However, the company has struggled in recent years under private ownership. Suthanthiran said he has lost millions of dollars since buying the business from MDS Nordion in 2007.The firm also faced a long labour dispute, with workers striking for nearly 10 months over pay.In November last year, the CNSC issued formal orders after discovering the company‚Äôs financial guarantee had expired. The regulator required Best Theratronics to set aside $1.8 million to cover potential cleanup costs if the site were to be decommissioned.Suthanthiran did not comply. He told CBC in October that the regulator was wrong and that he did not have the funds to restore the guarantee. Instead, he said he would abandon the nuclear licence and shift the company towards non-nuclear activities.In an email to CBC, Suthanthiran said the decision was forcing him ‚Äúto relocate to the USA and India‚Äù, and that the cost of maintaining the nuclear licence was too high.The regulator has ordered the company to submit monthly updates on its progress. However, it missed a December reporting deadline. Company representative Manny Subramanian told the commission the delay was due to Suthanthiran being out of the country.‚ÄúWe ended up sending about a day late or two days late because Krish, the president of the company, was travelling. We couldn‚Äôt get ahold of him,‚Äù Subramanian said.The next deadline comes on Tuesday, when Best Theratronics must submit an initial plan to decommission its Kanata plant.
Article Summary: Krishnan suthanthiran, owner of best theratronics, said surrendering the licence would lead to ‚Äòthe loss of 200 high-tech jobs‚Äô the company has secured export licences to ship its cobalt 60 and cesium 137 sealed sources out of canada.

Article Title: Philip Rivers vs. Tom Brady‚Äôs net worth: Who has had a more lucrative NFL career after nearly two decades in the league?
Article Text:
Tom Brady has teased his fans about returning from retirement like Philip Rivers.(Image via Brace Hemmelgarn/Getty, Otto Greule Jr/Getty)

Philip Rivers‚Äô net worth in 2025 that he has built through his own hard work



Tom Brady‚Äôs net worth in 2025 after having a longer career in the NFL and working with elite brands



Philip Rivers‚Äô return to the league as the Indianapolis Colts‚Äô oldest quarterback has taken the internet by storm.This has also sparked many speculations about Tom Brady returning to the field, considering how he has returned from retirement a couple of times.While Tom Brady‚Äôs return to the field remains unconfirmed, here‚Äôs a look at the net worth of two of the most talented athletes who have played in the NFL.According to Marca, the 44 year old Indianapolis Colts‚Äô quarterback has a net worth that is estimated to be a whopping $100 million.The Indianapolis Colts‚Äô quarterback has spent close to two decades playing in the NFL and was considered to be one of the most talented and highest paid quarterbacks for over fifteen years.As per Over The Cap, when Philip Rivers played in the NFL in 2020, his total career earnings from the league stood at a whopping $242 million.While Philip Rivers‚Äô earnings from the NFL was massive, the Indianapolis Colts‚Äô quarterback also endorsed renowned brands throughout his career that contributed to his massive net worth.Some of the most popular brands that Philip Rivers endorsed over the years include Bose, DirecTV, Advocare and Papa John‚Äôs.As per Celebrity Net Worth, as of publishing this article, the former Tampa Bay Buccaneers‚Äô star player, has a net worth which is estimated to be a whopping $300 million.While Philip Rivers spent seventeen years in the NFL, Tom Brady spent twenty seasons and won seven Super Bowls during his time in the league.As per reports, Tom Brady earned a whopping $333 million while he was playing in the NFL.Apart from his earnings in the NFL, Tom Brady also worked with a number of popular brands that contributed towards his wealth.This includes Under Armour, Aston Martin, Hertz, Subway, Fanatics, and Tag Heuer, through which he is estimated to have earned a whopping $140 million.It seems pretty clear that Tom Brady has had a more lucrative career in the NFL and has a greater net worth than Philip Rivers.While Philip Rivers has returned to the field, Tom Brady seems to be focusing on his career as an analyst.Also Read: Cardi B breaks silence after Stefon Diggs is rumored to be seen with alleged baby mama K‚Äôyanna Barber
Article Summary: Tom brady has teased his fans about returning from retirement like philip rivers. While philip rivers has returned to the field, tom brady seems to be focusing on his career as an analyst. Here‚Äôs a look at the net worth of two of the most talented athletes who have played in the nfl.

Article Title: Cardi B breaks silence after Stefon Diggs is rumored to be seen with alleged baby mama K‚Äôyanna Barber
Article Text:
Cardi B opens up about Stefon Diggs.(Image via Elsa/Getty Images)

Cardi B opens up about Stefon Diggs as fans believe that he might be cheating on her with his alleged baby mama, K‚Äôyanna Barber



Cardi B has spoken about how her life with Stefon Diggs is so much better



Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots, is enjoying a new chapter in his life with Grammy winner, Cardi B.While Stefon Diggs and Cardi B are busy taking care of their newborn amid a busy season, he was recently dragged into a new drama after fans were convinced he was spotted with his alleged baby drama, K‚Äôyanna Barber. Amid this, Cardi B has broken her silence.A few hours ago, Cardi B posted a heartfelt video of Stefon Diggs taking the field yesterday to face the Buffalo Bills.In the video posted by Cardi B, she seems to be zooming in on Stefon Diggs on the field as she was heard repeating, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt play with him‚Äù.While Cardi B seems to be focused on the current season, fans believe Stefon Diggs was spotted with his alleged baby mama, K‚Äôyanna Barber, as he launched his luxury furniture, Si Vis Pacem furniture line at Design Miami during Miami Art Basel.Interestingly, Cardi B and his mother were also spotted at the event.However, there is no confirmation if the woman Stefon Diggs was spotted with was indeed his alleged baby mama, K‚Äôyanna Barber.A month and a half ago, while Cardi B was still pregnant with their son, DJ Akademiks accused Stefon Diggs of getting a woman named K‚Äôyanna Barber pregnant at the same time.DJ Akademiks had taken to his social media to post a picture of K‚Äôyanna Barber flaunting her pregnant belly as he wrote, ‚ÄúStefon Diggs got ‚ÄòKiki do you love me are you riding‚Äô pregnant lmaooo birds of a feather. Pray for Cardi B‚Ä¶‚ÄùHowever, neither K‚Äôyanna Barber nor Stefon Diggs responded to the accusations as Cardi B stayed away from the drama.A few weeks ago, Cardi B opened up about giving birth to her son with Stefon Diggs as she said, "My last chapter was the beginning of a new season. Starting over is never easy but it‚Äôs been so worth it! I brought new music and a new album to the world!‚ÄùThe popular Grammy winner added, ‚ÄúA new baby into my world, and one more reason to be the best version of me, one more reason to love me more than anything else or anyone else so I can continue giving my babies the love and life they deserve."Also Read: Sherrone Moore and Paige Shiver‚Äôs alleged affair takes a new turn after shocking social media post sparks chaos among fans
Article Summary: Cardi b opens up about stefon diggs as fans believe that he might be cheating on her with his alleged baby mama, k‚Äôyanna barber. A month and a half ago, while cardi b was still pregnant with their son, dj akademiks accused the new england patriots player of getting a woman pregnant at the same time.

Article Title: OnePlus 15R to launch in India on December 17: Processor, camera, battery and other features we know so far
Article Text:
OnePlus 15R battery

OnePlus 15R camera

OnePlus 15R processor

OnePlus 15R display



OnePlus 15R AI features





OnePlus 15R is set to make its debut in the Indian market on December 17 in Bengaluru. Ahead of the scheduled launch, the company has revealed some features of the upcoming OnePlus smartphone which includes battery, display, camera and AI features. As revealed by the company, OnePlus 15R will be equipped with a 7,400mAh battery. The handset‚Äôs camera will offer a frame rate of 120 frames per second. The upcoming OnePlus 15R is confirmed to come with Plus Mind features. Here‚Äôs everything we know about OnePlus 15R so farOnePlus says that the OnePlus 15R will come with 7,400 mAh battery. The handset will feature the company‚Äôs propriety 80W SUPERVOOC fast charging technology.OnePlus also announced that the OnePlus 15R's camera can record 120 frames per second video at 4K resolution, previously only seen in the OnePlus 15.The company has confirmed that the upcoming smartphone will be equipped with ‚Äòmost advanced selfie camera on the R-series smartphone‚Äô. OnePlus 15R will have a 32 megapixel selfie camera, doubling the megapixel count on OnePlus 13R's 16 megapixel sensor.The handset will have same advanced computational photography algorithms, Ultra Clear Mode, Clear Burst, and the Clear Night Engine similar to OnePlus 15.OnePlus 15R will be powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 chipset. It also features the OnePlus G2 Wi-Fi chip, which ensures strong Wi-Fi connectivity wherever you are, and the Touch Response Chip, which allows the OnePlus 15R to sense touch significantly quicker than other devices.OnePlus 15R will come with a 165 Hz 1.5K AMOLED display, complete with 450 pixels per inch and the ability to go from 1800 nits of brightness. The display has received T√úV Rheinland Intelligent Eye Care 5.0 certification.Finally, the OnePlus 15R has also been revealed to support Plus Mind, the OnePlus AI technology dedicated to helping make life less complicated. It will come with a dedicated Plus Key to send whatever's on their phone screen to Plus Mind for safekeeping.
Article Summary: Oneplus 15r is set to make its debut in the indian market on december 17. The company has revealed some features of the upcoming smartphone which includes battery, display, camera and ai features. As revealed by the company, oneplus 15r will be equipped with a 7,400mah battery.

Article Title: American billionaire Mark Cuban to young engineers: Pick small or medium companies over MNCs as bringing new graduates on AI projects is ‚Ä¶
Article Text:
Cuban advice young engineers to not go behind big companies

The state of AI adoption





American billionaire and entrepreneur Mark Cuban has now urged the young engineers entering the job market to prioritise small and medium-sized companies over multinational corporations (MNCs) when seeking opportunities in artificial intelligence (AI). Cuban feels that smaller companies offer better platform for new graduates to make an immediate impact, while large corporations often dilute individual contributions.Speaking in an interview with CNBC and on his podcast The Dumbest Guy in the Room, Cuban explained that smaller companies are mainly entrepreneur-driven and they lack the deep IT departments or larger corporations. This gap creates opportunities for fresh graduates which directly contribute to the AI projects. ‚ÄúSmall- to medium-size companies don‚Äôt have that depth. They are typically entrepreneurially driven and don‚Äôt have the flexibility to have people research things. Bringing a new graduate on to work on agentic AI projects is inexpensive for them and can get them immediate results,‚Äù Cuban said.Cuban also used the example of his own company, Cost Plus Drugs, noting how AI can automate processes to boost productivity, competitiveness, and profitability.Cuban argued that in big organisations, AI skills may not stand out as they are common among thousands of IT employees. On the other hand, in smaller firms often lack such expertise, making new graduates with AI knowledge invaluable. He also compared the present wave of AI with early days of the internet, when young engineers were hired to implement new technologies because they were more comfortable with them than older executives.Cuban also highlighted that 95% of companies have not yet seen measurable revenue returns from AI investments. The exceptions, he said, are mostly early-stage startups led by young entrepreneurs who design their processes around AI models tailored to their businesses.He urged his children and other young people to learn as much as possible about AI, stressing that companies are still grappling with how to use the technology for competitive advantage.
Article Summary: Cuban advice young engineers to not go behind big companies for ai opportunities. He feels that smaller companies offer better platform for new graduates to make an immediate impact, while large corporations often dilute individual contributions. 95% of companies have not yet seen measurable revenue returns from ai investments.

Article Title: When Jeff Bezos said, my dream job is not running Amazon; but making slow, high-end ...
Article Text:
Jeff Bezos

Amazon Announces Landmark $35B Investment In India To Drive Digital Transformation

Not a bartender material, says Jeff Bezos





Amazon and how it changed shopping industry









Jeff Bezos has been credited to change the way people shop, however, the Amazon.com founder once revealed that his dream job was not running a trillion-dollar tech empire. In fact, his dream job was nothing related to technology but crafting high-end cocktails behind a bar. He was replying to a question from his brother Mark who asked about his dream job if money wasn't a factor.‚ÄúI pride myself on my craft cocktails. I do have this fantasy that I want to be a bartender,‚Äù he said. The conversation in question is a 2017 discussion. While opening up more on his ‚Äúfantasy‚Äù job, Bezos said that he has ‚Äúglamorised the job‚Äù in his mind, but he loves talking about a well-made drink.Bezos, however, said that he is not a ‚Äòbartender material‚Äô because he is slow and takes his time when crafting cocktails. ‚ÄúI'm super slow,‚Äù he said, joking that his bar would charge premium prices to make drinks slow. Bezos also said he would have a sign behind him, ‚ÄúYou can have it good or you can have it fast.‚ÄùWhile Bezos may not have got his dream job, he made billions from heading Amazon. He has a net worth of $238.4 billion, according to Forbes Billionaire List, making him the fourth richest person on Earth. He founded the e-commerce giant in 1994, which is now worth nearly $2.5 trillion.In 2021, he stepped down as Amazon's chief executive officer. Bezos also founded Blue Origin, a space company focused on making space travel safer and more affordable, and competes with Elon Musk.Recently, Bezos again took a job where he will serve as co-CEO of a new AI startup that focuses on engineering and manufacturing of computers, automobiles and spacecraft. The company is called Project Prometheus and it garnered $6.2 billion in funding, partly from his own company Amazon, making it one of the most well-financed early-stage startups in the world.
Article Summary: Jeff bezos once revealed that his dream job was not running a trillion-dollar tech empire but crafting high-end cocktails behind a bar. He said he has ‚Äòglamorised the job‚Äô in his mind, but he loves talking about a well-made drink. Bezos, however, said that he is not a ‚Äòbartender material‚Äô because he is slow.

Meanwhile, google's gemini surges, forcing openai to prioritize mass-market appeal and user feedback to regain dominance.

Article Title: Merriam-Webster‚Äôs picks ‚Äòslop‚Äô as word of 2025, in vogue due to AI
Article Text:
.





Washington: Creepy, zany and demonstrably fake content is often called ‚Äúslop‚Äù. The word‚Äôs proliferation online, in part thanks to the widespread availability of generative artificial intelligence, landed it Merriam-Webster‚Äôs 2025 word of the year. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs such an illustrative word,‚Äù said Greg Barlow, Merriam-Webster‚Äôs president ahead of Monday‚Äôs announcement. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs part of a transformative technology, AI, and it‚Äôs something that people have found fascinating, annoying and a little bit ridiculous.‚Äù‚ÄúSlop‚Äù was first used in the 1700s to mean soft mud, but it evolved more generally to mean something of little value. The definition has since expanded to mean ‚Äúdigital content of low quality that is produced usually in quantity by means of artificial intelligence‚Äù. In other words, ‚Äúyou know, absurd videos, weird advertising images, cheesy propaganda, fake news that looks real, junky AI-written digital books,‚Äù Barlow said.AI video generators have wowed with their ability to quickly create realistic clips based merely on text prompts. But a flood of these images on social media, including clips depicting celebrities and deceased public figures, has raised worries about misinformation, deepfakes and copyright.Such content has existed online for years, but the tools are more accessible now ‚Äî and used to political ends by, among other figures, the head of the Pentagon. Last month, defence secretary Pete Hegseth posted a manipulated image of a cartoon turtle, reimagined as a grenade-wielding fighter, to defend US military actions in Venezuela.The Canadian animated show ‚ÄúFranklin‚Äù teaches about kindness, empathy and inclusivity ‚Äî but in Hegseth‚Äôs hands, its main character became a tool to promote violence. The word ‚Äúslop‚Äù evokes unpleasant images of mud-caked pigs crowding around a dirty trough, or perhaps a bucket of steaming, fetid stew.To select the word of the year, the dictionary‚Äôs editors review data about which words have risen in searches and usage. Then they come to a consensus about which word best reflects the span of the year. ‚ÄúWe like to think that we are a mirror for people,‚Äù Barlow said.
Article Summary: Merriam-webster's 2025 word of the year is'slop' the word was first used in the 1700s to mean soft mud, but it evolved more generally to mean something of little value. The definition has since expanded to mean ‚Äòdigital content of low quality‚Äô

Article Title: Sophie Kinsella, author of the millions-selling ‚ÄòShopaholic‚Äô novels, dies at 55
Article Text:
-

LONDON:





Sophie Kinsella, the author of ‚ÄúConfessions of a Shopaholic‚Äù and a series of millions-selling rom-com sequels, died Monday, her family said. She was 55 and had been diagnosed with brain cancer. The family posted on Kinsella‚Äôs Instagram account: ‚ÄúWe are heartbroken to announce the passing this morning of our beloved Sophie (aka Maddy, aka Mummy). She died peacefully, with her final days filled with her true loves: family and music and warmth and Christmas and joy. ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt imagine what life will be like without her radiance and love of life.‚ÄùKinsella, who also published under her real name, Madeleine Wickham, announced in April 2024 that she had been diagnosed in late 2022 with glioblastoma, an aggressive form of brain cancer. ‚ÄúI did not share this before because I wanted to make sure that my children were able to hear and process the news in privacy and adapt to our ‚Äônew normal,‚Äô‚Äù she said at the time.Starting in 2000 with ‚ÄúThe Secret Dreamworld of a Shopaholic‚Äù, titled ‚ÄúConfessions of a Shopaholic‚Äù in the US, Kinsella published 10 ‚ÄúShopaholic‚Äù novels, along with other fiction. Her books have sold more than 45 million copies worldwide and have been translated into dozens of languages.The first two ‚ÄúShopaholic‚Äù books were adapted into the 2009 film ‚ÄúConfessions of a Shopaholic‚Äù, starring Isla Fisher and Hugh Dancy. Kinsella did not grow up intending to be a writer. One of three girls born to teachers in London, she played piano and violin as a child and also composed music. She told authorpublisher Zibby Owens on her podcastthat the idea of writing never crossed her mind.Kinsella enrolled at Oxford University to study music but switched to the politics, philosophy and economics program after one year. While at college, she fell in love with musician Henry Wickham. The couple had four sons and a daughter.After graduating, Kinsella began working as a financial journalist and spent her commute reading. The idea to write fiction herself began to take shape on the train. She published her debut novel, ‚ÄúThe Tennis Party‚Äù, in 1995 when she was 24, as Madeleine Wickham. Soon after, she left her journalism job to focus on writing. Six other books, including ‚ÄúThe Gatecrasher‚Äù and ‚ÄúSleeping Arrangements‚Äù, followed.An otherwise normal shopping excursion sparked the idea for writing her first ‚ÄúShopaholic‚Äù novel. ‚ÄúI remember looking around me and thinking... ‚ÄúWe all shop... We talk about it. We do it. We rejoice in it. We make bad decisions. Why hasn‚Äôt anybody written about this?‚Äù Kinsella said in 2019.Kinsella also wrote ‚ÄúThe Undomestic Goddess‚Äù, ‚ÄúRemember Me?‚Äù and ‚ÄúTwenties Girl‚Äù. A young adult novel, ‚ÄúFinding Audrey‚Äù, was released in 2015, followed by the children‚Äôs book series ‚ÄúMy Mummy Fairy and Me.‚ÄùHer novel ‚ÄúCan You Keep a Secret?‚Äù was adapted into a film starring Alexandra Daddario and Tyler Hoechlin in 2019. Her last novel was ‚ÄúThe Burnout,‚Äù released in 2023.After her diagnosis, she wrote a novella, ‚ÄúWhat Does It Feel Like‚Äù, about a woman with five children who has brain cancer. ‚ÄúI thought people might be curious to know what it‚Äôs like to go through this,‚Äù Kinsella said in an interview with TV personality Robin Roberts . ‚ÄúI hope it‚Äôs full of optimism and love most of all.‚Äù
Article Summary: Sophie kinsella, author of "confessions of a shopaholic," dies at 55. She was diagnosed with glioblastoma, an aggressive form of brain cancer. Her books have sold more than 45 million copies worldwide and have been translated into dozens of languages.

Article Title: Watch: Black bear attacks keeper during stage show at Hangzhou Safari Park, viral video triggers safety debate
Article Text: A pleasant and peaceful performance at Hangzhou Safari Park in East China‚Äôs Zhejiang Province on Saturday turned terrifying when a black bear suddenly attacked its keeper.Several videos are going viral on social media, showing audience members watching as two keepers guided two black bears onto the stage for another round of performance. One bear successfully performed, while the other, nearing the stage, pounced on its keeper and knocked him to the ground, Global News reported.The fallen keeper struggled to escape while nearby staff grabbed chairs and poles to separate the animal. After the bear was pulled away, it lunged at the keeper again, and staff had to use force to separate them.This footage prompted an online debate over whether animal performances should be banned. Other staff immediately intervened and used props to separate the bear from the keeper. Multiple social media users posted videos of the incident recorded during the bears‚Äô show.The park explained that the incident occurred as the keeper was carrying a large bag of carrots and apples; the bear saw the bag, became excited, and pounced on the keeper in an attempt to get the food, according to the notice. The notice also stated that the keeper said the incident reminded him to be more careful in dealings with the bear in the future.The official social media account of Hangzhou Safari Park posted a notice on Saturday stating that neither the keeper nor the bear was injured.One user, Momo, on the China's social media platform commented, ‚ÄúSafety must be a priority, and we should have respect for animals. Never think of them as cute and docile, or that we can control them.‚ÄùAnother user, Zero Geqian Qianqian, also emphasised the need to focus on safety. Many others have called for the cancellation of animal performances. A user named ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt Call Me Ma Ma Ma‚Äù asked, ‚ÄúWhen will animal performances be canceled? Isn‚Äôt it in animals‚Äô nature to be food-driven and protective of their food?‚ÄùSome users expressed sympathy for the bear. A user named ‚ÄúThe Girl is Out, I‚Äôm at Home‚Äù said, ‚ÄúA small bear is like a little baby. How could we make it perform? If it has apples, let it eat! If it were your child, would you make it perform first and then eat? If it‚Äôs hungry, then let it perform how to eat, it would be happier, the keeper and the bear would be more harmonious, and the audience would still enjoy it.‚ÄùOn the X also, several users commented on the video. One of the user said, "I see why the Russians train with them ü§£ü§£ü§£ that bear is a professional grappler."Another said, "Maybe if we didn't lock these animals up for our own amusement they wouldn't attack people."After the video of the bear attack went viral online and sparked debate, the park released a follow-up video showing that the bear and the keeper have since ‚Äúreconciled.‚Äù While feeding the black bear carrots, the keeper gently petted its head and said, ‚ÄúIf you want carrots, why did you snatch mine? [Even if you didn‚Äôt], I‚Äôll still give you some.‚Äù The black bear stood calmly and ate peacefully, displaying a gentle demeanour.
Article Summary: A black bear suddenly attacked its keeper at hangzhou safari park in china. The incident prompted an online debate over whether animal performances should be banned. The park released a follow-up video showing that the bear and the keeper have since ‚Äúreconciled‚Äù

Article Title: Emirates NBD launches UAE‚Äôs first bank-branded gold bar
Article Text:
Emirates NBD launches UAE‚Äôs first bank-branded gold bar, available in 10, 50, 100-gram denominations/Image: GDMO

What is Emirates NBD Gold



Significance for Dubai and the UAE



Leadership perspective



Accessibility and customer benefits







Emirates NBD has made history with the launch of ‚ÄòEmirates NBD Gold,‚Äô the UAE‚Äôs first bank-branded gold bar for savers and investors. The move not only strengthens Dubai‚Äôs status as a global hub for gold trading but also highlights the bank‚Äôs commitment to financial innovation, asset diversification, and customer centric solutions.Emirates NBD Gold is a bank issued gold bar designed for investors and savers seeking secure and tangible assets. This initiative marks the first time a UAE bank has launched a branded gold bar investment product, bridging the nation‚Äôs rich tradition in gold trading with modern financial innovation. Each bar comes in 10, 50, and 100 gram denominations and features the Emirates NBD logo. Every bar is accompanied by a unique certificate of authenticity and ownership, assuring customers of its legitimacy and value.The product is complemented by the Emirates NBD Gold Certificate, which allows customers to hold the gold in safe custody with the bank or take delivery as desired. Certificates can be accessed through Emirates NBD relationship managers or the bank‚Äôs digital platform, offering convenience and flexibility for investors.The launch of Emirates NBD Gold represents a major milestone in Dubai‚Äôs gold sector. By introducing a bank-branded gold product, Emirates NBD strengthens the emirate‚Äôs global reputation as a gold trading hub.The initiative aligns with the UAE‚Äôs broader vision of financial innovation, digital first solutions, and diversified investment options, supporting long-term economic growth and development.His Highness Sheikh Ahmed bin Saeed Al Maktoum, Chairman of Emirates NBD Group, emphasized that the launch reflects the bank‚Äôs transformation and its ability to deliver high quality products that meet investor aspirations while achieving global competitiveness. He noted that Emirates NBD Gold adds to the bank‚Äôs legacy and highlights its role in supporting the national economy and accelerating regional development.Hesham Abdulla Al Qassim, Vice Chairman and Managing Director of Emirates NBD Group, said the initiative continues a legacy that began in 1963 when Emirates NBD issued its first Letter of Credit to facilitate gold trade. He described Emirates NBD Gold as a product that combines tradition with innovation, offering investors a secure and modern way to invest in gold.Emirates NBD Gold is available exclusively to Emirates NBD customers. Investors can purchase gold bars through the bank‚Äôs branches or digital platforms. The product offers flexibility in ownership, allowing customers to store the bars with the bank or take physical delivery. By introducing this product, Emirates NBD provides a new avenue for customers to diversify their assets while ensuring security and authenticity.This strategic move reinforces Emirates NBD‚Äôs position as a leader in banking innovation in the region, unlocking new ways for investors to access physical wealth while contributing to community and economic development.
Article Summary: Emirates nbd launches uae‚Äôs first bank-branded gold bar, available in 10, 50, 100-gram denominations. Each bar is accompanied by a unique certificate of authenticity and ownership, assuring customers of its legitimacy and value. His highness sheikh ahmed bin saeed al maktoum, chairman of emirates nbd group, said the launch reflects the bank's transformation.

Article Title: How Dubai Courts are recognising Crypto as legal Property under UAE Digital Asset rules?
Article Text:
Dubai's Courts are giving your digital money real-world protection / Image: File

UAE‚Äôs new Digital Asset rules explained

Crypto is Intangible Personal Property: A key ruling in the Huobi v Tabarak case, following the enactment of the DIFC Digital Assets Law (No. 2 of 2024), formally classified cryptocurrencies and digital tokens as intangible personal property. This means your Bitcoin is now treated with the same legal respect as a stock certificate, a car title, or a traditional bank account balance.

The Power of the Freeze: Once classified as property, the courts gained the authority to use their most powerful legal defense tools. Most notably, they can issue Worldwide Freezing Orders (WFOs). If a judge suspects a fraudster is trying to move or liquidate stolen crypto, the WFO can effectively pause the assets globally. This is the single most important step in protecting investor capital during a dispute.

New tools for Crypto and Digital Asset

Secure Custody Services: The courts now have the ability to work with secure third-party custodians who can hold digital assets during legal proceedings. This ensures that crypto under dispute remains protected and traceable throughout the court process.

Blockchain Intelligence Tools: Judges and legal teams can use blockchain forensic tools to trace transactions on distributed ledgers. This is crucial in disputes involving stolen, lost or contested digital assets, where traditional financial tracking methods don‚Äôt apply.

Intelligence Tools: Judges and legal teams can use blockchain forensic tools to trace transactions on distributed ledgers. This is crucial in disputes involving stolen, lost or contested digital assets, where traditional financial tracking methods don‚Äôt apply. Training and Judicial Expertise: Court staff and judges are receiving technical training so they better understand blockchain, wallets, smart contracts and digital asset custody, bridging the gap between technology and the law.

Other regulatory framework in the UAE

In 2022, the UAE issued Cabinet Decision No. 111 of 2022 on the Regulation of Virtual Assets and their Service, requiring digital asset operations to be licensed and regulated, a foundational step in establishing legal clarity.

Dubai passed Law No. 4 of 2022 on the Regulation of Virtual Assets and its subsidiary regulations, empowering the Virtual Assets Regulatory Authority (VARA) to oversee onshore digital asset activities, including custody, issuance, and enforcement.

Separately, the DIFC enacted Digital Assets Law No. 2 of 2024, defining digital assets as intangible property, clarifying how ownership and control are legally understood, which is key for disputes, transfers and enforcement actions.





For years, the multi-billion dollar question for global investors was simple: is the code in your digital wallet legally considered "property"? If the law doesn't recognize it as such, then courts couldn't properly protect it. Well, Dubai has delivered a definitive answer, fundamentally changing the risk profile for anyone dealing in digital assets within the Emirate.The critical change came from the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) Courts, the specialized commercial judiciary that operates under Common Law principles. This legal body took decisive steps to establish a solid foundation for digital asset protection:To support this legal evolution, the DIFC Courts have rolled out specialised services and technologies tailored to digital asset disputes, making them crypto-ready:These innovations mean the Dubai judiciary can handle crypto disputes with the same confidence as traditional asset disputes, reducing ambiguity and strengthening enforcement.Dubai courts‚Äô efforts fit into a broader UAE strategy to regulate and secure digital assets:Together these rules form a legal infrastructure where digital assets are no longer grey-area technology, but recognised property with rights, protections, and legal remedies.Dubai is not just accepting digital assets, it is integrating them into its legal system with real protections and enforceable rights. From specialised court tools to updated regulations recognising crypto as property, the UAE is shaping a judicial environment ready for the digital economy‚Äôs future. This strategic evolution promises greater legal certainty, stronger investor trust, and a leading role for Dubai in global digital asset law.
Article Summary: Dubai's courts are giving your digital money real-world protection. The courts gained the authority to use their most powerful legal defense tools. They can issue worldwide freezing orders (wfos) if a judge suspects a fraudster is trying to move or liquidate stolen crypto, the wfo can effectively pause the assets.

Article Title: Qatar Ministry of Interior sets vehicle decoration rules for National Day 2025
Article Text:
The Ministry of Interior banned tinted windows, colour changes, and plate obstruction during National Day/Representative Image

Decoration period and vehicle guidelines





Window restrictions: Vehicles must not have tinted or coloured front or rear windshields. The driver‚Äôs side and front passenger side windows also cannot be tinted.

Original vehicle color: The original color of the vehicle must remain unchanged. Any attempts to repaint or cover the car with a different base color for National Day celebrations are prohibited.

Decoration placement rules





Licence plates: Decorations must not cover or obscure front and rear licence plates. This ensures that vehicles remain identifiable by authorities.

Sticker content: Any written stickers or messages applied to vehicles must be relevant to Qatar National Day. Messages unrelated to the celebrations are not permitted.

Ensuring compliance









As Qatar gears up for its National Day celebrations, the Ministry of Interior has issued clear guidelines for vehicle decorations to ensure safety and compliance. The rules, covering December 14 to 20, 2025, are designed to allow festive displays while keeping traffic regulations and public safety intact.The Ministry of Interior has specified that the approved period for decorating vehicles is from December 14 to December 20, 2025. During this time, drivers are welcome to showcase their festive spirit, but certain restrictions must be strictly followed.These measures aim to maintain visibility and safety for drivers and pedestrians alike.The Ministry has emphasized that while decorations are encouraged, they cannot compromise vehicle identification or safety features.These rules ensure that the festive mood does not interfere with law enforcement or traffic monitoring.The MoI has reinforced that these regulations are mandatory, and drivers should plan their decorations accordingly. By following the guidelines, participants can celebrate safely and legally, contributing to a vibrant yet controlled festive environment.
Article Summary: The ministry of interior banned tinted windows, colour changes, and plate obstruction during national day celebrations. Decorations must not cover or obscure front and rear licence plates. Messages unrelated to the celebrations are not permitted. These measures aim to maintain visibility and safety for drivers and pedestrians alike.

Article Title: UAE launches its first Licensed Sports Wagering and iGaming Website
Article Text:
UAE enters regulated online sports betting market officially / AI Generated Image

Play971: What iGaming offers?

UAE‚Äôs gaming regulation

Commercial gaming facility licences like the one awarded to Wynn Resorts for its upcoming integrated resort on Al Marjan Island in Ras Al Khaimah.

for its upcoming integrated resort on Al Marjan Island in Ras Al Khaimah. Vendor licences to international gaming suppliers, allowing them to offer equipment, software and technology to licensed operators in the UAE market.

Supplier licences like the one obtained by Sportradar, a major sports data and betting services provider, further strengthening the ecosystem for regulated online sports wagering and gaming.

How to download Play971?





The United Arab Emirates has taken a major step into the world of regulated online gaming and sports betting with the launch of its first licensed internet gaming and sports wagering website. The platform, called Play971, is officially authorised and regulated by the General Commercial Gaming Regulatory Authority (GCGRA), the federal body responsible for supervising all commercial gaming activity in the country.Play971 is operated by Coin Technology Projects LLC, a firm incorporated in Abu Dhabi with its main base at Twofour54 Yas Creative Hub, and claims to be fully ‚Äúlocated, licensed and regulated in the UAE.‚Äù This launch marks a significant milestone for a country that has long been known for strict anti-gambling laws rooted in cultural and religious norms.Play971‚Äôs debut represents more than just a new website. It introduces a regulated environment for real-money online games and sports wagering that did not exist before under UAE law. The platform includes a range of casino-style games and sports betting markets, including popular events like football and tennis.Under the supervision of the GCGRA, players and operators must follow strict responsible gaming standards, including systems to verify user identity and ensure that only eligible participants within the UAE can access the service. This controlled launch currently applies in certain emirates such as Abu Dhabi and Ras Al Khaimah, with broader availability expected in early 2026 as the regulatory framework and licensing system evolves.This early rollout serves as a test case for future operators, and regulators continue to refine licensing categories, supplier approvals and compliance rules so that the market expands safely and transparently.The UAE‚Äôs move toward regulated online gaming builds on multiple earlier steps. In 2024, the first official lottery licence was awarded to The Game LLC, beginning regulated draw operations with major prizes.According to the General Commercial Gaming Regulatory Authority (GCGRA), internet gaming is considered a form of ‚Äúcommercial gaming conducted via the internet, using computers, mobile phones, or other digital devices with access to websites or apps that offer games and bets involving chance, skill, or a combination of both.‚Äù The regulator notes that these games include bingo, casino games such as slots and poker, eSports, fantasy games, peer-to-peer games, skill-based games, sports betting, and more.On sports wagering specifically, the GCGRA explains that it ‚Äúinvolves betting on the outcome of sports events or the performance of athletes or teams,‚Äù and that wagers can only be placed legally through licensed operators and sportsbooks.Separately, the GCGRA has also issued:Together, these moves show the UAE modernising its commercial gaming landscape with a regulated, consumer-safe framework rather than a permissive or unregulated market.At launch, Play971 is accessible primarily through its official website, rather than via public app stores. Users can register and play directly online, following identity verification and eligibility checks required by the UAE‚Äôs gaming regulator.As of now, no standalone mobile app has been publicly listed on major platforms such as Apple‚Äôs App Store or Google Play. This cautious approach aligns with the UAE‚Äôs tightly controlled regulatory rollout, ensuring compliance with responsible gaming and digital licensing standards before wider distribution.According to industry observers and regulatory context shared in official announcements, any future mobile app rollout, whether on iOS or Android, would require separate approvals from the General Commercial Gaming Regulatory Authority (GCGRA), as well as compliance with platform-specific policies.The availability of Play971 is also being introduced in phases, with access currently aligned to emirates and jurisdictions where regulatory readiness has been confirmed, including Abu Dhabi and Ras Al Khaimah. Wider nationwide access is expected to follow only after regulators complete further reviews of system performance, consumer safeguards, and operational compliance.Officials have stressed that users should avoid unlicensed apps or websites claiming to offer UAE-approved betting services, as Play971 remains the only legally licensed online sports wagering and iGaming platform in the country at this stage.With the national lottery, casino-resort projects, vendor license and now Play971, the UAE is slowly but deliberately building a regulated commercial gaming ecosystem that is secure and transparent for consumers and operators alike.
Article Summary: Uae enters regulated online sports betting market officially. Play971 is officially authorised and regulated by the general commercial gaming regulatory authority. The platform includes a range of casino-style games and sports betting markets. This launch marks a significant milestone for a country that has long been known for strict anti-gambling laws.

Article Title: Kuwait: Expats can renew Civil ID digitally without stepping out; Here‚Äôs how
Article Text:
Kuwaiti citizens and expats can renew Civil ID without office visits/Representative Image

Russia Thwarts Ukrainian Land Attack Near Krasnoarmeysk As Drones Hit Russian Cities

Renewal through the

Sahel application

:

Renewal through the PACI website:

Renewal by telephone:

Renewal via text message:





Renewing a Civil ID in Kuwait no longer requires a visit to a service center. The Public Authority for Civil Information has reaffirmed that both Kuwaiti citizens and expatriates can complete the renewal process through four approved channels, supporting its wider effort to simplify government services and reduce in-person visits.The Public Authority for Civil Information, or PACI, confirmed that individuals can choose the renewal method that best suits their preference and accessibility. These options are intended to improve efficiency, expand access, and ensure the uninterrupted delivery of essential civil services.One option available to the public is renewal through the unified government services application, Sahel. This method allows users to complete the Civil ID renewal process digitally with minimal steps, making it a convenient choice for those who rely on mobile platforms to manage government transactions.Civil ID cards can also be renewed easily online through PACI‚Äôs official website at paci.gov.kw. Through this channel, applicants are able to submit their renewal requests online and follow the required procedures without the need to visit a PACI service center.PACI has also enabled Civil ID renewal by telephone. Applicants can complete the transaction by contacting the designated service numbers, offering a practical solution for individuals who prefer voice-based services or do not regularly use online platforms.In addition, Civil ID renewal can be carried out by sending a text message. This option provides a simple alternative for users who may not have access to smartphones or internet services. PACI emphasized that offering these four renewal channels is aimed at enhancing accessibility, improving efficiency, and ensuring the continuous delivery of essential civil services to both citizens and expatriates.
Article Summary: Kuwaiti citizens and expats can renew civil id without office visits. Civil id cards can also be renewed easily online through paci‚Äôs official website at paci.gov.kw. Paci emphasized that offering these four renewal channels is aimed at enhancing accessibility, improving efficiency, and ensuring the continuous delivery of essential services.
